title: What is the best book to learn React? - Quora

response.answer_text: React JS is a progressive JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is developed by Facebook. React JS can be used in the development of Single Page Applications (SPA) and mobile applications. Its main focus is to provide speed, simplicity, and scalability. Here you will get best React JS books for building user interfaces. 1. Learning React by Kirupa Chinnathambi  ISBN-13: 978–0134546315ISBN-10: 0134546318 Learning React helps you to understand the fundamentals of React Js and how to use it to build really awesome apps. This is a practical guide for building a high-performance web application using React Js. What You Will Learn: How to build your first react app.You will be able to create single page app using React Router.Create components to define parts of your UI.How to use JSX to specify visuals without writing full-fledged JavaScript.You will learn how to optimize your React workflow using tools such as Node, Babel, web pack, and others.Understand component lifecycle.This book includes some basic projects.Creating a sliding menu using React motion.2. The Road to learn React: Your journey to master plain yet pragmatic React.js by Robin Wieruch  ISBN-10: 1986338827ISBN-13: 978–1986338820 ‘The Road to learn React’ teaches you the fundamentals of React Js. You will able to build a real-world application along the way in plain React Js without complicated tooling. What You Will Learn: You will be able to build your own applications in React Js.Learn, general concepts, patterns and best practices in a real-world React application.How to interact with Forms and Events.Able to get real data with an API.This book covers real-world features like pagination, client-side caching and interactions like searching and sorting.How to transition from JavaScript ES5 to JavaScript ES6.You will be able how to code organization and testing.How react components works.This book includes a lot of exercise with each chapter.3. Learning React: Functional Web Development with React and Redux by Alex Banks and Eve Porcello  ISBN-13: 978–1491954621ISBN-10: 1491954620 If you want to learn how to build effective user interfaces with React JS then this book will be your first choice. ‘Learning React: Functional Web Development with React and Redux’ shows you how to create UIs with this small JavaScript library that can deftly display data changes on large-scale, data-driven websites without page reloads. What You Will Learn: Learn how to structure React Js applications.How to use a routing solution for browser history, bookmarks, and other features of single-page applications.You will learn how to work with functional programming and the latest ECMAScript features.Able to learn key functional programming concepts with JavaScript.How to build React Js components with this hands-on guide.Understand how useful React Js can be in your organization.Create application presentation layers by mounting and composing React components.This book also includes React JS component lifecycle and use it to load data and improve UI performance.4. React Design Patterns and Best Practices: Build easy to scale modular applications using the most powerful components and design patterns by Michele Bertoli  ISBN-10: 1786464535ISBN-13: 978–1786464538 This book shows you how to apply design patterns and best practices in real-life situations, whether that is for new or already existing projects. ‘React Design Patterns and Best Practices’ helps you to make your applications more flexible, perform better, and easier to maintain. What You Will Learn: How to create reusable components.You will able to write clean and maintainable code.Build high-performing applications by optimizing components.How to improve the performance of your applications.This book covers testing and debugging.How to use server-side rendering to make applications load faster.It describes everything you should know about React Js.How to use React Js effectively in the browser and node.5. React Quickly: Painless web apps with React, JSX, Redux, and GraphQL by Azat Marden  ISBN-13: 978–1617293344ISBN-10: 1617293342 ‘React Quickly’ is for all who wants to learn React Js quickly. This practical book teaches you the concepts you need with lots of examples, tutorials, and a large main project that gets built throughout the book. What You Will Learn: Learn React development using your existing JavaScript and web development skills.You will learn React component lifecycle events.How to use JSX efficiently in your React Js applications.Build full web apps with data and routing.How to optimize React Js apps.You will learn about web components, forms, and data.How to use React Js with Node, Express Js, Mongo DB, Mongoose.This book includes many real-life projects which help you increase your React Js knowledge.6. React.js Book: Learning React JavaScript Library from Scratch by Greg Sidelnikov  ISBN-13: 978–1521546185ISBN-10: 1521546185 ‘Learning React JavaScript Library from Scratch’ will walk you step by step through the process of setting up a development environment and learning Reactive programming from start to finish. What You Will Learn: You will learn React JS library.How to use main principles of Reactive Programming.Discover Component Structure.Learn, React JS lifecycle methods.Able to learn Component Instances.7. React: Up & Running: Building Web Applications by Stoyan Stefanovs  ISBN-13: 978–1491931820ISBN-10: 1491931825 ‘React: Up & Running: Building Web Applications teaches you how to build components — React’s basic building blocks — and organize them into maintainable, large-scale apps. By this book, you will build a complete custom Whinepad app that helps user’s rate wines and keep notes. What You Will Learn: You will learn how React JS works.Create and use custom React JS components alongside generic DOM components.Build a data table component that lets you edit, sort, search, and export its contents.Use the JSX syntax extension as an alternative to function calls.How to manage communication between components with Flux.Use ESLint, Flow, and Jest tools to check and test your code as your app evolves.How to set up a lean, low-level build process that helps you focus on React JS.

Figuring out that a flexible, high-paying career as a web developer is the dream is the easy part. Where it gets harder is figuring out exactly what skills you need to land a job. If you’re planning on building websites for a living, you probably know you’ll need to learn coding languages like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, but you’ll also notice developer job listings that call for less familiar skills. One buzzy skill you’ll see pop up is React.  It is currently most in demand and every other company is looking for it. What are your chances. Very very bright. Reason is simple. Most of us are running after either Data Science or Python because of the hype around it. So very few people are opting for it . So huge demand but no supply. Other good things: Only Front End.No need to learn SQL, any other skill.One language only-JavaScript.Very much doable.Focus on only one thing.Salary as good as full stack developer.So a React developer earns as good or even more than JAVA or .NET guys who work on back-end. Even they know so many things.  What Is React Developer ? React developer will be creating the interactive part of web, by creating components which can send and recieve data from a backend server. He will be responsible for the rendering of components which is having customised requirements. for example he may need to create a button which can show a spinner inside it on sending a http request and will turn to back to a normal button on success/error of the request, it is very simple part of the task that a dev may get. Best Book to Learn React - Videos can get overwhelming. Books let you learn at your own pace and are generally very focused. There are dozens of books online but many of them jump around to different subjects. How does someone get started from the very beginning learning React from the ground-up? I tried to learn React when I worked at my last company – but due to time constraints hired a contractor to help me complete a big project.This year – I (finally) understand React and this book- Mastering React native really helped me stay away from the reason why I had a hard time learning it last year – information overload.  this book clearly explains how and why it fits like a glove, and how to separate how, when, where and why Javascript, HTML, CSS and JSX are used. He also just covers the topics that are essential to React – which is clearly an object oriented front end technology – and he introduces “just enough” of Router and Redux – two libraries that too many other authors get opinionated fast on their use.
